AD_HonourGuardCaptain_Combat.synopsis: Lines for one of the guards in the final fight after EmperorPlea dialog - one line per turn
AD_HonourGuardCaptain_Combat.how_to_trigger: Fight the gith after EmperorPlea dialog

AD_HonourGuard04_Combat.synopsis: Combat ADs for one of the honour guards in the final fight. One line will play at the start of their turn if they're alive.
AD_HonourGuard04_Combat.how_to_trigger: Get to the final combat in Intermezzo.

AD_EmperorDead.synopsis: Shouted in victory by the Gish Lieutenant after the Emperor dies.
AD_EmperorDead.how_to_trigger: Emperor dies in combat vs Gish.

PAD_FirstTimeInAstralPrison.synopsis: PAD when the player enters the astral prison in Intermezzo.A DaisyAD follows on from this PAD - DaisyAD is INT_EmperorRevealed_DaisyPAD_FirstTimeInAstralPrison
PAD_FirstTimeInAstralPrison.how_to_trigger: Long rest at INT camp to trigger gith camp combat.Enter the portal to the astral prison.

PAD_NonTadpoledReactToVoA.synopsis: The non-tadpoled characters react to their comrades being crushed under the Voice of the Absolute.
PAD_NonTadpoledReactToVoA.how_to_trigger: Have a non-tadpoled character in your party when first resting in Intermezzo.

AD_CombatAtCamp.synopsis: Two of Orpheus' honourguard chase the players back through the portal to the material plane. They immediately sense the illithid influence on them and attack.
AD_CombatAtCamp.how_to_trigger: Side with the gith against the Emperor in INT. Bring him to low HP and then he will send you back to the Material plane.

DaisyPAD_FirstTimeInAstralPrison.synopsis: Converted to a DaisyAD but the dialog filename hasn't yet changed.This is the line Daisy says after the player's PAD on entering the astral prison.PAD that comes before this is INT_EmperorRevealed_PAD_FirstTimeInAstralPrison
DaisyPAD_FirstTimeInAstralPrison.how_to_trigger: Go into the Astral Portal in INT.

AD_MidFight.synopsis: If we attack the Emperor, it doesn't defend itself. During its turn, it reiterates that you have to co-operate.

DaisyAD_AfterCombatGetToTheSkull.synopsis: Daisy urges the player on after combat with one of the two Gith groups inside the Astral Prison
DaisyAD_AfterCombatGetToTheSkull.how_to_trigger: Finish a combat with a group of Gith inside the astral prison.

AD_DontHitMePlease.synopsis: The Emperor asks the Player to stop hitting them.
AD_DontHitMePlease.how_to_trigger: Attack the Emperor out of combat in INT.

AD_HonourGuard01_Combat.synopsis: Combat ADs for one of the honour guards in the final fight. One line will play at the start of their turn if they're alive.
AD_HonourGuard01_Combat.how_to_trigger: Get to the final combat in Intermezzo.

VB_CantSleep.synopsis: The character expresses the fact that they're actively being turned into a thrall and that taking a nap would be a bad plan.
VB_CantSleep.how_to_trigger: Attempt to go back to sleep during Intermezzo.

PAD_AttemptToAttackOrpheus.synopsis: PAD when the player attempts to attack Orpheus.

AD_ReturnToAPCombat.synopsis: One of the gith royal guard shouts this on their turn when you enter combat after EmperorPlea dialog

NarratorAD_CrystalsImmuneToAttacks.synopsis: The player attampts to hit the crystals, and finds them immune to their assault. and the narrator describes the magic being very powerful (setup for the Orphic Hammer in END).
NarratorAD_CrystalsImmuneToAttacks.how_to_trigger: The discerning player notices that the red crystals have health bars and tries to give them a tap.

EmperorPlea.synopsis: The Emperor tries to get you to help it destroy Orpheus' royal guard so that it can subdue Orpheus again. If you side with the Emperor, you fight against the githyanki with the help of the Emperor and the intellect devourers. If you side with the githyanki, the Emperor feels betrayed and will teleport you back to the material plane where you have a few turns to get back inside the portal and some githyanki to kill on your way.
EmperorPlea.how_to_trigger: Go near the Emperor in the Astral Plane during Intermezzo

AD_EmperorCallsObjectiveDuringOrpheusFig.synopsis: Spoken on The Emperor's turns in the Orpheus Chamber fight in Intermezzo.Urging the player and keeping them on-target.
AD_EmperorCallsObjectiveDuringOrpheusFig.how_to_trigger: Trigger the Orpheus fight in Intermezzo.

DaisyAD_GetInThePortal.synopsis: DaisyAD plays while player is in combat with githyanki en route to the portal.

AfterOrpheus.synopsis: With Orpheus subdued, players learn of the true nature of Daisy, some of the Emperor's backstory, the technicality of how Orpheus' power protects them, and the scale of what they are up against when it comes to the Brain's intelligence. They might transform into a half-illithid.
AfterOrpheus.how_to_trigger: Enter the Astral Prison in INT, and successfully subdue Orpheus.-> Open the debug book (ctrl + shift + 9)-> Select act 2b, and Intermezzo-> Select "After Orpheus Chamber Fight"-> Approach the battle to join in-> ReCon: killcombat-> The dialogue will begin

AD_EmperorRezzesAvatar.synopsis: The Emperor resurrects Avatars after the Orpheus Chamber fight, if it needs to.
AD_EmperorRezzesAvatar.how_to_trigger: Ensure that the avatar is dead.Complete the Orpheus Fight in Intermezzo.

AD_IntellectDevourer_CombatEnds.synopsis: AD for finishing a popcorn fight with IDs in Astral Prison, to push the player towards the skull and the Emperor.One ID as speaker as placeholder, will need scripting support to make it all IDs.
AD_IntellectDevourer_CombatEnds.how_to_trigger: Interact with an ID in Intermezzo - Astral Prison

AD_EmperorThanksAfterHealing.synopsis: The Emperor thanks the player for healing it.
AD_EmperorThanksAfterHealing.how_to_trigger: Trigger the Orpheus fight in Intermezzo.

EmperorAD_StopHittingMeAfterOrpheus.synopsis: The Emperor kindly asks the player to stop hitting it.
EmperorAD_StopHittingMeAfterOrpheus.how_to_trigger: Attack the Emperor after the Orpheus combat.

EmperorDies.synopsis: If the player kills the Emperor, the Emperor dies, the portal collapses, all players are pulled through an astral rift, and wind up in the

NarratorAD_DescribeOrb.synopsis: The player clicks on the Orb item around Orpheus after he has been resubdued, and the narrator describes it.
NarratorAD_DescribeOrb.how_to_trigger: The player clicks on the Orb item around Orpheus after he has been resubdued.

AD_CombatAtCamp_03.synopsis: Yelled by a gith invading camp through the portal on their turn in combat.
AD_CombatAtCamp_03.how_to_trigger: Go to Act2b Intermezzo.Use the bedroll.Click through the dialog until combat begins.

AD_IntellectDevourer_Interaction.synopsis: Response when an intellect devourer is interacted with in Intermezzo - Astral Prison. BEFORE Orpheus is subdued. One ID as speaker as placeholder, will need scripting support to make it all IDs.
AD_IntellectDevourer_Interaction.how_to_trigger: Interact with an ID in Intermezzo - Astral Prison

AD_CombatAtCamp_02.synopsis: Yelled by a gith invading camp through the portal on their turn in combat.
AD_CombatAtCamp_02.how_to_trigger: Go to Act2b Intermezzo.Use the bedroll.Click through the dialog until combat begins.

PAD_NotDemonsButGith.synopsis: The players see the corpses of some of Orpheus' Royal Guard. They remark that they are not the demonic figures that
PAD_NotDemonsButGith.how_to_trigger: Complete the first unavoidable combat in the EmperorRevealed situation in the Astral Prison.

OrbExplodes.how_to_trigger: Enter the Astral Prison in Intermezzo.

DaisyAD_InsideAstralPrisonHurry.synopsis: Generic Daisy urge we can use to hurry players in the Astral Prison if they're hanging around a bit. Sequential AD. Will be played pretty frequently, so we'll need a good handful.
DaisyAD_InsideAstralPrisonHurry.how_to_trigger: Take too long inside the Astral Prison.

AD_IntellectDevourer_AfterCombat.synopsis: Response when an intellect devourer is interacted with in Intermezzo - Astral Prison. AFTER Orpheus is subdued. One ID as speaker as placeholder, will need scripting support to make it all IDs.
AD_IntellectDevourer_AfterCombat.how_to_trigger: Interact with an ID in Intermezzo - Astral Prison after Orpheus has been subdued.

PAD_ReactingToOrpheusRocks.synopsis: The player observes Orpheus' binds and the crimson rocks they come from.
PAD_ReactingToOrpheusRocks.how_to_trigger: After the Orpheus Chamber fight, observe the rocks that he is bound to.

AD_EmperorInPain.synopsis: Player attacks the emperor, and the emperor yelps in pain.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO.synopsis: The players are woken up by the booming voice of the Absolute becoming unbearable. The artefact struggles and eventually shines bright, opening a portal (seen in gameplay) to the Astral Plane. GROUP_Players in SpeakerGroup1 is the active player.
WokenUpAtNight_SCO.how_to_trigger: Go to sleep during the ArriveIntermezzo camp night.

AD_Gith_CombTheArea.synopsis: Spoken by a gith as they wander the surrounding area in Astral Prison.
AD_Gith_CombTheArea.how_to_trigger: Go towards, but do not start combat with, a gith in Astral Prison.

DaisyAD_CallToHelp.synopsis: Daisy calls the player to enter the portal and help. (They're trying to subdue Orpheus, who's trying to break free.)
DaisyAD_CallToHelp.how_to_trigger: Plays after the dialog that players see in the middle of the night when going to sleep in Intermezzo in which the Voice of the Absolute is heard.

AD_CombatAtCamp_NewWave_01.synopsis: Yelled by a gith invading camp through the portal on the turn they are spawned.
AD_CombatAtCamp_NewWave_01.how_to_trigger: Go to Act2b Intermezzo.Use the bedroll.Click through the dialog until combat begins.

PAD_LetsJustRest.synopsis: A nudge for the player to go to sleep to continue the story. Plays after player returns from Astral Prism having met the Emperor and after the GD in which the group reflects on the fact that the dream visitor was a mind flayer all along.
PAD_LetsJustRest.how_to_trigger: In the return to camp after EmperorRevealed, walk around the empty camp.

AD_FirstContactWithGith.synopsis: The players enter the Astral Prison to find a small group ofSilver Swords mopping up a group of intellect devourers. They spot the players and attack them!
AD_FirstContactWithGith.how_to_trigger: Enter the Astral Prison during Intermezzo.

AD_HonourGuardCaptain_Combat_1.speaker: High Gish'ra G'imre
AD_HonourGuardCaptain_Combat_1.text: Hta'zith! Your death in Gith's name!

AD_HonourGuardCaptain_Combat_2.speaker: High Gish'ra G'imre
AD_HonourGuardCaptain_Combat_2.text: You have no place here, is'tark!

AD_HonourGuard04_Combat_3.speaker: Zephyr Gish'ra Verik
AD_HonourGuard04_Combat_3.context: NodeContext: Prince = Prince Orpheus, the true heir of the githyanki throne

AD_EmperorDead_0.speaker: Prelate Lir'i'c
AD_EmperorDead_0.text: Gith'ka tavkim krash'ht! Honour will be ours.
AD_EmperorDead_0.context: NodeContext: 'Gith's light guides us' - GITH-ka TAHV-keem KRASH-ht

PAD_FirstTimeInAstralPrison_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FirstTimeInAstralPrison_0.context: NodeContext: stressed and urgent, we just fought some githyanki, went through a portal, and witnessed the destruction of a giant orb around a huge skull, we've been told to help with some urgency

DaisyPAD_FirstTimeInAstralPrison_0.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyPAD_FirstTimeInAstralPrison_0.text: I'm here - help me! I'm under attack!
DaisyPAD_FirstTimeInAstralPrison_0.context: NodeContext: speaking telepathically with urgency while under attack

AD_MidFight_0.speaker: The Emperor
AD_MidFight_0.text: The guards are your enemy, not I. I am on your side.

DaisyAD_AfterCombatGetToTheSkull_0.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_AfterCombatGetToTheSkull_0.text: It's not over - come to the skull!

AD_DontHitMePlease_0.speaker: The Emperor
AD_DontHitMePlease_0.text: Don't do that. It won't help you.

AD_HonourGuard01_Combat_2.speaker: Ember Gish'ra M'i'hayk
AD_HonourGuard01_Combat_2.context: NodeContext: GITH-ka TAV-keem KRAHSH-ht - "Gith's light guides us"

VB_CantSleep_0.speaker: Player
VB_CantSleep_0.text: This would be the worst time to take a nap.

PAD_AttemptToAttackOrpheus_0.speaker: Player
PAD_AttemptToAttackOrpheus_0.text: It's no use. Can't reach him like this.

AD_ReturnToAPCombat_1.speaker: Prelate Lir'i'c
AD_ReturnToAPCombat_1.context: NodeContext: HTA-lak KRITH ma-HAR ("Die, treacherous scum of the worst order!")

NarratorAD_CrystalsImmuneToAttacks_0.speaker: Narrator
NarratorAD_CrystalsImmuneToAttacks_0.text: *The rock resists all attempts to shatter it.*

EmperorPlea_4.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player, being physically in the Astral plane, enters a full-blown battle. Before us, 4 of Orpheus' guards fight against a mind flayer, The Emperor/Daisy.

The Emperor holds his hands up, they are buzzing with psionic energy. He is trying to recreate the globe of domination with one hand, and uses telekenis with the other to fling a stone toward the guards.

One of the guards kicks the stone to the side, following through to knock the Emperor down toward the player.

EmperorPlea_65.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The globe stops forming.

At the centre, Orpheus is chained (with VFX lightning chains) to a rock by the infernal shackles he wears, unmoving, his eyes rolled back to the whites (or equivalent cool VFX suggesting he is subdued.) His head is also snapped back so that he looks unseeing at the sky.

EmperorPlea_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: Intellect devourers swarm the guards, and the battle moves away from the player and Emperor.

EmperorPlea_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the absence of the globe of domination we see the chains that bind Orpheus stop glowing. Orpheus’ head straightens to its natural position as he ‘awakens’. A closeup on Orpheus’ face as his eyes roll back to their natural state. He is ‘free’ of the Emperor’s psionic control (though still unable to move.)

EmperorPlea_25.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_25.text: Before you do anything - I am your ally.
EmperorPlea_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: From the ground, the Emperor locks eyes with us and speaks.

EmperorPlea_9.speaker: Jaheira
EmperorPlea_9.text: You are in danger indeed, mind flayer. What the hells is happening?

EmperorPlea_19.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_19.text: The githyanki is the source of our protection against the Absolute. I MUST subdue him or everything we've worked towards is lost.
EmperorPlea_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Orpheus. His eyes lock on us.

EmperorPlea_26.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_26.text: Don't let my form deceive you. I am the one that's been protecting you. I am the one that came to you in your dreams.
EmperorPlea_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Emperor getting to his feet.

EmperorPlea_62.speaker: Player
EmperorPlea_62.text: What do you need me to do?

EmperorPlea_27.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_27.text: The honour guard - eliminate them. My forces are weakened by their assault. But with your help, we can turn this around.

EmperorPlea_38.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_38.text: Destroy the guard. I will subdue their master.

EmperorPlea_73.speaker: Player
EmperorPlea_73.text: I want no part in the slaughter of my kin.

EmperorPlea_86.speaker: Player
EmperorPlea_86.text: I'm not helping a mind flayer.

EmperorPlea_84.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_84.text: You do not understand. He will attack anyone that reeks of illithid - that includes YOU.

EmperorPlea_0.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_0.text: And you will not even be able to defend yourself. If you kill him, the Absolute will enthral you.

EmperorPlea_49.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor pins its gaze on us, a mix of fear and anger.

EmperorPlea_53.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_53.text: I AM THE REASON YOU ARE FREE.

EmperorPlea_14.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_14.text: We are more alike than you want to admit. Look past it. I know you don't want to, but you must.

EmperorPlea_13.speaker: Player
EmperorPlea_13.text: Prove to me that you are who you say.

EmperorPlea_71.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_71.text: You saved a child from a viper, back in the druids' grove.

EmperorPlea_36.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_36.text: You slept with the drow Minthara. You pleased her.

EmperorPlea_87.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_87.text: You killed the aasimar Nightsong. You didn't have to.

EmperorPlea_81.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_81.text: You saved the aasimar Nightsong from her soul cage.

EmperorPlea_55.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_55.text: The last time you were here, you tried to kill me. Not far from this very spot.

EmperorPlea_33.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_33.text: You let me live, last time you were here. Though it brought Vlaakith's wrath upon you.

EmperorPlea_17.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_17.text: I told you about my room in the Elfsong Tavern, that night when you held me. I was vulnerable - you comforted me.

EmperorPlea_75.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_75.text: Your continued existence as yourself and not a mind flayer should be all the proof you need.

EmperorPlea_39.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_39.text: You shared an intimate night with the drow, Minthara.

EmperorPlea_72.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_72.text: Do NOT be driven by fear! Trust me now and I promise you will have all the answers you seek.

EmperorPlea_60.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_60.text: The guard. Destroy the guard. They prevent me from subduing their master.

EmperorPlea_43.speaker: Player
EmperorPlea_43.text: Try to read the mind flayer's thoughts.

EmperorPlea_3.speaker: Narrator
EmperorPlea_3.text: *Despite your best attempts to be subtle, the mind flayer's awareness is everywhere. You blunder in its presence like a worg pup learning to walk.*

EmperorPlea_11.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_11.text: You must be joking. I am TELLING you my thoughts. Directly. Into. Your. Head.

EmperorPlea_85.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_85.text: But if you insist on taking a look for yourself, BE MY GUEST.

EmperorPlea_46.speaker: Narrator
EmperorPlea_46.text: *Nothing in your colourful existence to date could have prepared you for this.*
EmperorPlea_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor closes his eyes. The player enter a mindmeld with them. The connection is held briefly then they drop to one knee, mentally overwhlemed.

EmperorPlea_41.speaker: Narrator
EmperorPlea_41.text: *As the horror subsides, you are left with only one coherent thought - you must do whatever you can to subdue the githyanki.*
EmperorPlea_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see the player reeling as the mindmeld ends before they get back to their feet, woozily.

EmperorPlea_90.speaker: Lae'zel
EmperorPlea_90.text: Aid an illithid against githyanki? We cannot, we must not!

EmperorPlea_79.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_79.text: Your blind loyalty will be your undoing, Lae'zel. Fight with me. For your own survival.

EmperorPlea_12.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_12.text: Together we can turn the tide.

EmperorPlea_45.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_45.text: FOOL. Without me you will perish!

EmperorPlea_64.speaker: Player
EmperorPlea_64.text: I will not betray my people!

EmperorPlea_54.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_54.text: Then you would betray yourself and all your allies? Without me you will perish!

EmperorPlea_32.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_32.text: That was awful. Just awful. You haven't even IMPROVED since your last attempt!

EmperorPlea_69.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_69.text: You must be joking. Look around you - we are at WAR.

EmperorPlea_58.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_58.text: Fight with me. Your future depends on it!

EmperorPlea_16.speaker: Player
EmperorPlea_16.text: This is the battle you were fighting?

EmperorPlea_44.speaker: Player
EmperorPlea_44.text: I don't believe you. You're a mind flayer.

EmperorPlea_47.speaker: Lae'zel
EmperorPlea_47.text: Ghaik abomination! By the One True Sky, what is this madness?

EmperorPlea_68.speaker: Shadowheart
EmperorPlea_68.text: A mind flayer? What's going on here?!

EmperorPlea_78.speaker: Gale
EmperorPlea_78.text: A mind flayer? What the blazes is going on here?

EmperorPlea_89.speaker: Astarion
EmperorPlea_89.text: Another tentacled freak? What in the hells is this?

EmperorPlea_91.speaker: Halsin
EmperorPlea_91.text: A mind flayer? What foul trickery is this?

EmperorPlea_59.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
EmperorPlea_59.text: Explain yourself, illithid, or we will end you.
EmperorPlea_59.context: NodeContext: unnerved but in control as the party encounter an illlithid that claims to be their ally - situation is tense and urgent

EmperorPlea_88.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor is really struggling now that we have attacked him.

EmperorPlea_63.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_63.text: I should have known. This wasn't the first time you tried to kill me.

EmperorPlea_70.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorPlea_70.text: But without me, you will perish!

AD_EmperorCallsObjectiveDuringOrpheusFig.speaker: The Emperor
AD_EmperorCallsObjectiveDuringOrpheusFig.text: I must regain control over the githyanki prince!

DaisyAD_GetInThePortal_0.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_GetInThePortal_0.text: Fight your way to the portal. I need your help!

DaisyAD_GetInThePortal_1.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_GetInThePortal_1.text: More are coming - hurry! Or we will all become thralls!

DaisyAD_GetInThePortal_2.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_GetInThePortal_2.text: Come quickly - I can't do this without you!

AfterOrpheus_90.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor hovers down to where Orpheus is chained. He brings psionic energy to his hands. Closeup of Orpheus’ face, eyes looking at Emperor with fear and hatred. Sweat dripping.

AfterOrpheus_196.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor raises his arms. A beam of light goes out, reforming the globe of domination around Orpheus. Orpheus’ head rolls back, his eyes roll back to the whites again. All is still once more. 

The Emperor turns and approaches the player.

AfterOrpheus_73.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_73.text: Your reluctance to help nearly cost us everything. You saw reason just in time.

AfterOrpheus_31.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_31.text: Thank you. That was too close.

AfterOrpheus_206.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_206.text: But you are not the one I wish to speak with. Bring me your leader.

AfterOrpheus_289.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_289.text: Don't look at me like that.
AfterOrpheus_289.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player's uneasy reaction to the Emperor being a mind flayer.

AfterOrpheus_288.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_288.text: I am a mind flayer, yes. And the one who saved you. Again.

AfterOrpheus_71.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_71.text: I am a mind flayer, yes. Without me you would be a slave to the Absolute.

AfterOrpheus_149.speaker: Narrator
AfterOrpheus_149.text: *To owe your life to a deceitful illithid - you could never have imagined a truth so obscene.*

AfterOrpheus_81.speaker: Narrator
AfterOrpheus_81.text: *Your thoughts turn to the caged githyanki. Is this the target Vlaakith asked you to slay?*

AfterOrpheus_237.speaker: Lae'zel
AfterOrpheus_237.text: It's obscene - to owe my life to a damned ghaik.

AfterOrpheus_153.speaker: Lae'zel
AfterOrpheus_153.text: No more lies, no more tricks. I will have answers!

AfterOrpheus_217.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_217.text: I ask again - who are you? And I'm going to need a name this time.

AfterOrpheus_231.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_231.text: You may call me the Emperor.

AfterOrpheus_85.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_85.text: If I'd known you would be so open-minded, I could have saved myself a lot of effort.

AfterOrpheus_159.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_159.text: But I'm glad you're not here to judge.

AfterOrpheus_192.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_192.text: I always suspected you were a mind flayer.

AfterOrpheus_179.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_179.text: I suppose it was considerate of you not to bring it up before. And I ask that you do not judge me for it now.

AfterOrpheus_23.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_23.text: I was someone once. Someone just like you.

AfterOrpheus_184.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor pulls us into a mindmeld.

AfterOrpheus_70.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_70.text: An adventurer. I came from Baldur's Gate, though I was never one to be constrained by circumstance. I longed for more.
AfterOrpheus_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see the adventurer, hooded, his identity unknown, sitting atop one of Baldur’s Gate’s outer walls. One one side, the city. On the other, the wilderness. A glance to the wilderness, and we see him drop off to that side of the wall.

AfterOrpheus_88.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_88.text: That longing brought me to Moonrise Towers on a search for treasure. To a colony of mind flayers who caught me, changed me into what I am now.
AfterOrpheus_88.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A boot stomps on a jutting piece of land (like the final step to get to the top of Everest.) The other boot follows. The adventurer has stopped there. A map in his hand. He's arrived: Moonrise Towers (before the shadow-curse.)

Cut to: mind flayer approaching the back of a board on which the adventurer is strapped and struggling. The mind flayer carries a tadpole (throwback to intro cinematic.) Closeup of the adventurer's eye as the tadpole goes in. Fade to black to screams of the adventurer. Fade in: Shot of the same room, clasps being undone on the board. A naked mind flayer rises - the Emperor.

AfterOrpheus_83.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_83.text: For years I served the elder brain - the one you know as the Absolute. I was a thrall like any other. But I was fortunate. I broke free, and started a new life in my old city.
AfterOrpheus_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of elder brain, psionic charges emanating off it, connecting to legions of mind flayers. We see our mind flayer walking at night, cloaked, down a street in the city. It looks around to make sure it wasn’t followed, before disappearing through a door.

AfterOrpheus_38.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_38.text: I sustained myself on criminals. Unglamorous, but there were plenty of them, rarely missed, and they fuelled me while I did my work.
AfterOrpheus_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: A prison. Shadows flit over the prison’s walls by candlelight. A scream. Shot of mind flayer, wearing the garments we later find in the Elfsong Tavern (garments that disguise its true form) suckling on a criminal’s brain in its cell. The door has been broken open by its psionic strength.

AfterOrpheus_52.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_52.text: I had the good fortune to meet Duke Stelmane. We formed a partnership, and through her I became the governing force behind the Knights of the Shield, the largest mercantile operation in Baldur's Gate.
AfterOrpheus_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor in Stelmane’s office, colluding with her over a big map of the city on the table. While we look at the map, the ‘reach’ of the Knights of the shield is visualised across the map as more and more regions come under their control.

AfterOrpheus_295.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_295.text: People referred to me as the Emperor - such was my influence. Though, of course, they had no idea what I really was.
AfterOrpheus_295.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stelmane conducting business with a merchant. The merchant eyes the door to her office warily. Through a gap in the door, we see the vague outline of the Emperor like an unidentified mob boss sitting in its chair. Eyes faintly glowing, shape indiscernible. We see the merchant's unease.

AfterOrpheus_247.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_247.text: My needs were sated. I was... happy. For a while. Until my true nature was discovered by the tyrant himself - Lord Gortash.
AfterOrpheus_247.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor and Stelmane toasting to their success in her office. (Emperor’s drink should probably look like brain parts rather than humanoid alcohol.) A bang as the door bursts open. They both look at the door in horror.

AfterOrpheus_57.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_57.text: He tore me from my home and brought me back to the brain where I became a slave once again. A slave he continued to call the Emperor.
AfterOrpheus_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot from Emperor’s POV of chains and magic lashing, binding him. Blurring in and out as if fading in and out of consciousness. Next conscious moment: staring at the stars through bars on the back of some sort of horsecart. Next conscious moment: the mind flayer colony coming into view. Mind flayers turn to stare. Next conscious moment: the elder brain, and beside it, Gortash.

AfterOrpheus_151.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_151.text: The name was intended as a slight - to remind me of the heights from which I fell. But I have grown fond of it. It encapsulates well who I've become.
AfterOrpheus_151.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot that pans out from the Emperor, showing it to be one among many (though wearing its distinctive garb). Non-mindmeld Emperor’s hand waves, wiping away the image, revealing it standing there before us. Mindmeld over.

AfterOrpheus_158.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_158.text: Vlaakith is eternal. My people would not be swayed by this false prince.

AfterOrpheus_108.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_108.text: On the contrary, Vlaakith is quite fallible. Not all githyanki eyes are so clouded as yours.

AfterOrpheus_95.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_95.text: The return of Gith's son would mean the end of Vlaakith. There is no plainer truth.

AfterOrpheus_22.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_22.text: Lord Gortash was one of the Chosen in the colony...

AfterOrpheus_169.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_169.text: Indeed. His hubris knows no bounds. To enslave me, that was his nature. But to enslave an elder brain? A questionable decision.

AfterOrpheus_29.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_29.text: I shall look forward to sharing his downfall with you.

AfterOrpheus_286.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_286.text: Ghaik lies, the whole lot. Orpheus is dead. The history is written!

AfterOrpheus_60.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_60.text: A history writ by whose hand?

AfterOrpheus_143.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_143.text: Your trust in Vlaakith is understandable. Her lie is carved in your people's slates, bold as truth - yet a lie it remains.

AfterOrpheus_185.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_185.text: Did you have to eat criminals' brains?

AfterOrpheus_193.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_193.text: Rather them than potential future allies... like you.

AfterOrpheus_107.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_107.text: I didn't realise mind flayers could be independent thinkers.

AfterOrpheus_24.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_24.text: Not all mind flayers are alike.

AfterOrpheus_134.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_134.text: I have always valued freedom above all else. In my past life and present.

AfterOrpheus_207.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_207.text: It has been a burning need within me for as long as I can remember.

AfterOrpheus_292.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_292.text: So are you going to tell me what this battle was about?

AfterOrpheus_228.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_228.text: We fought to tame Prince Orpheus, the son of Gith herself.
AfterOrpheus_228.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus on Orpheus. Emperor begins to walk and talk around Orpheus.

AfterOrpheus_118.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_118.text: How did you end up in here?

AfterOrpheus_16.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_16.text: Gortash sent me on a mission to retrieve the Astral Prism. I was one of many, but the first to find it.

AfterOrpheus_186.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_186.text: How Gortash or the other Chosen learned of its existence, I do not know.

AfterOrpheus_180.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_180.text: That githyanki in the sphere - who is it?

AfterOrpheus_157.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_157.text: Prince Orpheus, son of the first leader of the githyanki.
AfterOrpheus_157.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus on Orpheus. Emperor begins to walk and talk around Orpheus.

AfterOrpheus_46.speaker: Narrator
AfterOrpheus_46.text: *Orpheus - Gith's son, the so-called 'traitor prince', slain by Kith'rak Voss himself millennia ago. Or so you believed.*

AfterOrpheus_243.speaker: Lae'zel
AfterOrpheus_243.text: Orpheus? Impossible. He was slain by Jhe'stil Kith'rak himself!

AfterOrpheus_84.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_84.text: His power has been the source of your continued protection against the voice of the Absolute - the power to disrupt hivemind communication.

AfterOrpheus_30.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_30.text: It is the same power that enabled Orpheus' mother to bring about the fall of the Illithid Empire aeons ago, a power she passed on to him, and that I leveraged for you.

AfterOrpheus_152.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_152.text: When Orpheus' mother left, a usurper took her place - Vlaakith declared herself 'queen' of the githyanki.

AfterOrpheus_225.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_225.text: Vlaakith wanted his power, but Orpheus rose against her. And so she sealed him and his honour guard within this Prism.

AfterOrpheus_50.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_50.text: Vlaakith wanted his power. He refused. And so she sealed him within this Prism. His honour guard, ever loyal, followed him in.

AfterOrpheus_171.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_171.text: Bound by infernal chains, Orpheus could never leave. Bound by duty, his guard never would.

AfterOrpheus_190.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_190.text: They were close to breaking my hold on their prince - and if they had succeeded, we would be lost.

AfterOrpheus_14.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_14.text: I am relieved you have embraced your potential enough that you could help me eliminate them.
AfterOrpheus_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: He leaves Orpheus' side. We focus on Emperor and us now.

AfterOrpheus_166.speaker: Lae'zel
AfterOrpheus_166.text: Control him? Bah - the traitor must be ripped apart, brain to belly!

AfterOrpheus_232.speaker: Lae'zel
AfterOrpheus_232.text: Control him? Tsk'va - you must return him to his people!

AfterOrpheus_0.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_0.text: Alone, Orpheus will be much easier to control.

AfterOrpheus_165.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_165.text: Was it you or Orpheus that Vlaakith wanted us to kill when she ordered us inside the Prism?

AfterOrpheus_89.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_89.text: Most certainly Orpheus. He is a threat to her reign.

AfterOrpheus_34.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_34.text: Some githyanki still revere him, in defiance of their teachings. Vlaakith was safe as long as they believed him to be dead. But as you can see, he is very much alive.

AfterOrpheus_272.speaker: Lae'zel
AfterOrpheus_272.text: I don't understand. The histories claim the prince was burned to ash in the skies.

AfterOrpheus_178.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_178.text: Your histories are fabrications. The prince was not killed, as you can very well see - he was imprisoned.

AfterOrpheus_9.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_9.text: She kept him this way because she was reluctant to eradicate such power, power that she might one day wish to take from him.

AfterOrpheus_12.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_12.text: If the githyanki ever find out what she has done, there will be civil war. Vlaakith will be finished.

AfterOrpheus_284.speaker: Lae'zel
AfterOrpheus_284.text: Vlaakith is eternal! My people would not be swayed by this... this false prince.

AfterOrpheus_230.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_230.text: On the contrary, Vlaakith is quite fallible. Not all githyanki eyes are so clouded as yours.

AfterOrpheus_110.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_110.text: The return of Gith's son would mean the end of Vlaakith. There is no plainer truth.

AfterOrpheus_287.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_287.text: Why did Orpheus refuse to aid Queen Vlaakith?

AfterOrpheus_126.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_126.text: Why did Orpheus refuse to aid Queen Vlaakith?

AfterOrpheus_218.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_218.text: I do not have the privilege of knowing the answer, but the consequences are clear enough.

AfterOrpheus_215.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_215.text: How did Gortash and the other Chosen find out about the Astral Prism?

AfterOrpheus_145.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_145.text: A very good question. One that I have been unable to answer.

AfterOrpheus_290.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_290.text: That Orpheus lives at all is ruinous to Vlaakith - she has done everything in her power to keep his existence a secret.

AfterOrpheus_229.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_229.text: That Gortash and the Chosen found out about it... this is impossible to explain.

AfterOrpheus_182.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_182.text: But it was important enough to them that Gortash sent me to retrieve it.

AfterOrpheus_2.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_2.text: The moment I found it, I felt a change. My free will returning. I followed the feeling inside -

AfterOrpheus_170.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_170.text: I realised what the Prism was for - containment.

AfterOrpheus_61.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_61.text: While my body was within the Prism's bounds, my mind was free. I could resist the elder brain, the Chosen. Better yet, I could plan to overthrow them.

AfterOrpheus_175.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_175.text: All I needed to do was subdue Orpheus and find allies in the outer world. You.

AfterOrpheus_253.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_253.text: All I needed to do was subdue the githyanki and find allies in the outer world. You.

AfterOrpheus_266.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_266.text: What happens if we free Orpheus?

AfterOrpheus_63.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_63.text: That would be a terrible idea.

AfterOrpheus_127.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_127.text: The moment he is free, he will attack you. Your only defence would be to kill him. And in so doing, you would doom us both.

AfterOrpheus_44.speaker: Narrator
AfterOrpheus_44.text: *Even though he is subdued, you feel Orpheus' revulsion - a pulsing hatred that cannot be contained. The Emperor is telling the truth. To him, you are just another wretched illithid.*
AfterOrpheus_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Show Orpheus glaring at you

AfterOrpheus_245.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_245.text: You carry a tadpole. As far as Orpheus is concerned, you are already illithid - a sworn enemy. Just like me.

AfterOrpheus_58.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_58.text: We're alike in other ways too.

AfterOrpheus_188.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_188.text: I'm glad you think so. I agree. But there is one thing you have that I do not.

AfterOrpheus_223.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_223.text: My original body was destroyed when I transformed. Yours continues to limit you.

AfterOrpheus_150.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_150.text: The more I talk to you, the less you seem like a mind flayer.

AfterOrpheus_227.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_227.text: I appreciate that. But this is what I am.

AfterOrpheus_278.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_278.text: My original body was destroyed when I transformed.

AfterOrpheus_279.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_279.text: When I first escaped from the elder brain, I searched for a new vessel. But the longer I inhabited this one, the more it grew on me.

AfterOrpheus_105.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_105.text: I realised that returning to my former self would only impose limitations.

AfterOrpheus_37.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_37.text: Any advantage I could gain by restoring my original appearance, I already had to hand in the form of magic, and that humanoid shape you've come to know.

AfterOrpheus_99.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_99.text: As an illithid, I have far surpassed who I ever was before. You, too, should embrace this change.

AfterOrpheus_109.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_109.text: I'm pleased to hear that. You will do very well as an illithid.

AfterOrpheus_121.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_121.text: The transformation will not be complete - the physical alteration in particular will be only partial. But your potential will certainly be amplified.

AfterOrpheus_72.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_72.text: Would you like to do it? Would you like to evolve?

AfterOrpheus_17.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_17.text: On reflection, I've changed my mind. Please don't evolve me.

AfterOrpheus_249.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_249.text: I believe we'll have a better chance of defeating the elder brain if you embrace your latent illithid potential.

AfterOrpheus_65.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_65.text: I don't like what you're implying...

AfterOrpheus_113.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_113.text: Like it or not, our chances of defeating the elder brain are substantially improved if you embrace your latent illithid potential.

AfterOrpheus_280.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_280.text: I've been studying you for a while now. I believe I can trigger the next stage of your tadpole's lifecycle while continuing to preserve your independence.

AfterOrpheus_125.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_125.text: You have seen what I can do. Imagine yourself with the same strength. The same intelligence. The same devastating beauty.

AfterOrpheus_67.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_67.text: If you let me, I can evolve you.

AfterOrpheus_283.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_283.text: You will be able to do things you never thought were possible.

AfterOrpheus_141.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_141.text: There will be... physical alterations, of course. But only partial. You will retain most of your current form.

AfterOrpheus_252.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_252.text: And you will soon see that the benefits outweigh any perceived loss.

AfterOrpheus_210.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_210.text: Do it. I'd like to evolve.

AfterOrpheus_45.speaker: Lae'zel
AfterOrpheus_45.text: Tsk'va! Whatever this ghaik offers is no gift to you.

AfterOrpheus_87.speaker: Shadowheart
AfterOrpheus_87.text: Well... certainly brave of you, I'll say that much.

AfterOrpheus_130.speaker: Astarion
AfterOrpheus_130.text: I'm happy to have more powerful friends, but... well, better you than me.
AfterOrpheus_130.context: NodeContext: Player wants to transform into a half-mind flayer

AfterOrpheus_122.speaker: Wyll
AfterOrpheus_122.text: By Balduran's helm, only a fiend or fool would bargain with this damnable creature.

AfterOrpheus_62.speaker: Wyll
AfterOrpheus_62.text: Well chosen. An accursed advantage - but an advantage all the same.

AfterOrpheus_101.speaker: Gale
AfterOrpheus_101.text: That's a bell you can't unring. Perhaps you should reconsider.

AfterOrpheus_1.speaker: Gale
AfterOrpheus_1.text: A fine idea. Or at least, an idea.

AfterOrpheus_4.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor reacts with surprise.

AfterOrpheus_20.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_20.text: Your mind is - truly - something special.

AfterOrpheus_221.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holds out their hand. The Emperor takes out an astral-touched tadpole and psionically manoevures it into the player's open palm. It looks like an inert rock.

AfterOrpheus_32.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_32.text: It wants to evolve, but it cannot do so alone. It must commune with another.

AfterOrpheus_296.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_296.text: A tadpole, nurtured by the psionic energy of the Astral Plane. Cocooned here for millennia, it has become extraordinary.

AfterOrpheus_248.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_248.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player tilts their head back and drops the stone in. The Emperor looks disconcerted by this.

AfterOrpheus_168.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_168.text: But if you had opened your mind to it rather than consuming it, your allies could have taken advantage of its power as well.

AfterOrpheus_129.speaker: Narrator
AfterOrpheus_129.text: *The tadpole's essence courses through you - where it touches, your flesh, glands, organs contract and flood with pure thought.*
AfterOrpheus_129.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player transforms into a partial-illithid. Veins light up under the skin as the transformation makes its way around their body. They observe their own body parts as it works its way around.

AfterOrpheus_131.speaker: Narrator
AfterOrpheus_131.text: *You feel... different. Your body has never felt more connected. Your mind present in every flex of a joint or muscle.*
AfterOrpheus_131.context: CinematicNodeContext: The transformation is over. The player opens their eyes and takes in the change in their skin with surprise, but not displeasure.

AfterOrpheus_282.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_282.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor looks you up and down. A shot of the player in partial-illithid form. InternalNodeContext: He's admiring you, perhaps even a little turned on. In a hungry kind of way. NodeContext: a little breathless

AfterOrpheus_140.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_140.text: When your allies see what you can do... I hope you'll encourage them to try it for themselves.

AfterOrpheus_154.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_154.text: But we mustn't lose focus. We need to resume our journey.

AfterOrpheus_128.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_128.text: You heard the Chosen - the brain has gone to the city, and the army marches to follow.

AfterOrpheus_167.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_167.text: We must not let them reach it. We must find the brain, and bring it under our control.

AfterOrpheus_94.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_94.text: Open your mind to the tadpole.

AfterOrpheus_244.speaker: Narrator
AfterOrpheus_244.text: *A coldness seeps through your veins as the tadpole awakens, its yearning almost unbearable. Your mind is a veritable feast.*
AfterOrpheus_244.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the inert stone that contains the astral-touched tadpole glowing with life at its core.

AfterOrpheus_91.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_91.text: Drop it on the ground and stomp on it.

AfterOrpheus_267.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player drops the astral-touched tadpole on the ground and stomps it into pieces.

AfterOrpheus_64.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_64.text: Do you know how hard it was to find that? To cultivate it to be safe for communion?

AfterOrpheus_257.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_257.text: Understandable. It's a big decision. Keep it until you're ready.
AfterOrpheus_257.context: CinematicNodeContext: With a quick hand gesture, the Emperor psionically closes our fingers around the astral-touched tadpole.

AfterOrpheus_291.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_291.text: You and your allies - it has enough vitality to nourish you all - to further your evolution.

AfterOrpheus_176.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_176.text: Perhaps you will be more inclined to try it when you see more of what our enemy can do.

AfterOrpheus_120.speaker: Narrator
AfterOrpheus_120.text: *The tadpole screams for growth with painful intensity. It has been starved - of life, of purpose. It welcomes your probing like a void waiting to be filled.*

AfterOrpheus_115.speaker: Narrator
AfterOrpheus_115.text: *If you let it, it will evolve you, just as the Emperor said.*

AfterOrpheus_66.speaker: Narrator
AfterOrpheus_66.text: *The tadpole prickles with excitement, its thoughts rampant and chaotic in its rush to communicate with you. It is impossible to discern any single intention.*

AfterOrpheus_25.speaker: Narrator
AfterOrpheus_25.text: *A wave of disappointment, stronger than any you've ever felt, and then - stillness. You have resisted your illithid instincts. For now.*

AfterOrpheus_123.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_123.text: You are not ready yet. Keep hold of it then, until you are.
AfterOrpheus_123.context: CinematicNodeContext: With a quick hand gesture, the Emperor psionically closes our fingers around the astral-touched tadpole.

AfterOrpheus_264.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_264.text: It has enough vitality to further your evolution and your allies'.

AfterOrpheus_262.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_262.text: Perhaps you will be more inclined to try it when you see more of what our enemy can do.

AfterOrpheus_173.speaker: Narrator
AfterOrpheus_173.text: *A raging pain tears through your head as thoughts and instincts do battle within it. Then - silence. Your mind opens, and all resistance evaporates...*

AfterOrpheus_297.speaker: Narrator
AfterOrpheus_297.text: *You may resist now, but it's too late. You already embraced the powers the parasite gave you. You leveraged them to manipulate, to dominate, to survive.*

AfterOrpheus_263.speaker: Narrator
AfterOrpheus_263.text: *Your nature is no longer your own - you are well on your way to fulfilling your illithid potential. You are ready to evolve.*

AfterOrpheus_47.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_47.text: I changed my mind. I don't want to do that right now.

AfterOrpheus_183.speaker: Narrator
AfterOrpheus_183.text: *Even as you say the words, you feel a lurch of disappointment. Your mind bristles with illithid potential. How could you be so cruel as to deny yourself what you want most in the world?*

AfterOrpheus_220.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_220.text: I felt that. It's your nature. You cannot fight it, so - embrace it.
AfterOrpheus_220.context: NodeContext: with pleasure - he felt that you are at war with yourself and now open to doing the thing he wants

AfterOrpheus_219.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_219.text: Was it something I said? Never mind.

AfterOrpheus_28.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_28.text: Perhaps you will change your mind again when you see more of what our enemy can do.

AfterOrpheus_201.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_201.text: Look after it. Use it when you are ready to evolve.

AfterOrpheus_96.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_96.text: You or your allies - it has vitality enough for you all.

AfterOrpheus_162.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_162.text: Even as you are, you have shown rationality that puts you far above your kind. You will do well as an illithid.

AfterOrpheus_235.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_235.text: We have had our disagreements - but in the end you always do what needs to be done.

AfterOrpheus_40.speaker: Karlach
AfterOrpheus_40.text: Don't do it! This isn't evolution, it's... it's... I don't know what it is.

AfterOrpheus_78.speaker: Karlach
AfterOrpheus_78.text: I guess this is our best chance. You can handle it. And I'll still like you just the same.

AfterOrpheus_13.speaker: Halsin
AfterOrpheus_13.text: Are you sure of this course? It is not one that can be reversed, I fear.

AfterOrpheus_8.speaker: Jaheira
AfterOrpheus_8.text: Take care. Illithids evolve nothing - they only enslave.

AfterOrpheus_273.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AfterOrpheus_273.text: A little more caution would be wise. Such power is tempting, but you risk losing yourself.

AfterOrpheus_164.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_164.text: If you can evolve me, why can't you stop ceremorphosis altogether?

AfterOrpheus_226.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_226.text: The answer is twofold. One - I can, but it would kill you. As I told you before.

AfterOrpheus_148.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_148.text: Two - why would I? You have done well with the limited form you have, but you would do far better as an illithid.
AfterOrpheus_148.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor gestures at the player vaguely.

AfterOrpheus_36.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_36.text: So - do you wish to evolve or not?

AfterOrpheus_53.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_53.text: I understand. Let us hope, then, that your present self will be sufficient to deal with three gods of death and a giant, magically enhanced elder brain.
AfterOrpheus_53.context: NodeContext: with a touch of sarcasm - these are BIG almost impossible-to-defeat things

AfterOrpheus_133.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_133.text: But in case you change your mind -

AfterOrpheus_139.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_139.text: I'm trying to avoid becoming a mind flayer - I thought you agreed to protect me.

AfterOrpheus_191.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_191.text: You have already benefited from that tadpole of yours.

AfterOrpheus_41.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_41.text: I'm no illithid, and never will be.

AfterOrpheus_55.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_55.text: You are already more illithid than you realise - it has improved you.

AfterOrpheus_177.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_177.text: You seek to reverse an inevitable process, a process of evolution. When I first escaped from the elder brain, I too railed against the change. But the longer I have inhabited this form, the more it has grown on me.

AfterOrpheus_155.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_155.text: Even if my original body remained intact after I transformed, I would not return to it. Doing so would only impose limitations.

AfterOrpheus_277.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_277.text: Could we kill Orpheus and seize his power?

AfterOrpheus_21.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_21.text: There may come a time when that is necessary, but there is no guarantee that his power would survive his passing. The risk is too great.

AfterOrpheus_172.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_172.text: The moment his protection is gone, you would become enthralled to the elder brain just as I would.

AfterOrpheus_114.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_114.text: We may look different, but to the elder brain we are already the same - thralls in its design.

AfterOrpheus_102.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_102.text: It's like I said before - I'm just like you.

AfterOrpheus_222.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_222.text: You were in the Prism all this time? Why did you deceive me?

AfterOrpheus_10.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_10.text: Why did you deceive me all this time?

AfterOrpheus_138.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_138.text: It was necessary. Rare are those that would openly consider a partnership with a mind flayer.

AfterOrpheus_268.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_268.text: Even those who are on a path of becoming one.

AfterOrpheus_274.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_274.text: I prefer the other version of you.

AfterOrpheus_174.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_174.text: You grew attached to a mere disguise. But you judge without even knowing me.

AfterOrpheus_261.speaker: Player
AfterOrpheus_261.text: A ghaik illusion, an abomination - as I've suspected.

AfterOrpheus_293.speaker: Jaheira
AfterOrpheus_293.text: And so we should swoon and offer a kiss, abomination? I would not even know where to plant it.

AfterOrpheus_271.speaker: Halsin
AfterOrpheus_271.text: To owe one's life to a mind flayer? It seems to make mockery of this entire struggle.

AfterOrpheus_270.speaker: Shadowheart
AfterOrpheus_270.text: Of all the beings to be indebted to... a bloody mind flayer.

AfterOrpheus_294.speaker: Wyll
AfterOrpheus_294.text: By the living gods - no more visions, no more lies. I expect answers. Now.

AfterOrpheus_189.speaker: Karlach
AfterOrpheus_189.text: A mind flayer? How is this possible? Gods, we've been so... blind.

AfterOrpheus_233.speaker: Gale
AfterOrpheus_233.text: A mind flayer? Not the saviour I'd been hoping for.

AfterOrpheus_35.speaker: Astarion
AfterOrpheus_35.text: I owe everything to that? Oh I don't like this one bit.
AfterOrpheus_35.context: NodeContext: Slightly repulsed, just found out his ally is a mindflayer

AfterOrpheus_258.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AfterOrpheus_258.text: An unnerving revelation. But if this is our protector, so be it.

AfterOrpheus_142.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_142.text: Go ahead - I cannot leave with you, but I will continue to protect the infected.

AfterOrpheus_147.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_147.text: Since you destroyed my gift, there is nothing further I can do for you right now. Proceed.

AfterOrpheus_199.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_199.text: Don't look at me like that.

AfterOrpheus_213.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_213.text: Consider using the tadpole. Your evolution will be a benefit to us both.

AfterOrpheus_224.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_224.text: I will only speak with the one in charge.

AfterOrpheus_234.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_234.text: Since you ingested my gift instead of using it, there is nothing further I can do for you right now. Proceed.

AfterOrpheus_256.speaker: The Emperor
AfterOrpheus_256.text: Go to the city. Try out your new form. Enjoy it.

AD_EmperorRezzesAvatar_0.speaker: The Emperor
AD_EmperorRezzesAvatar_0.text: Stand. Now is not your time. We have much to discuss.

EmperorAD_StopHittingMeAfterOrpheus_1.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
EmperorAD_StopHittingMeAfterOrpheus_1.text: Stop it! I am not your enemy!

EmperorDies_0.speaker: Narrator
EmperorDies_0.text: *Somewhere between pity and disappointment, the Emperor's final gaze cuts through you, signalling your joint downfall.*
EmperorDies_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor lies on the floor, about to die. It looks at you with one last pleading glance.

EmperorDies_9.speaker: Narrator
EmperorDies_9.text: *Its laboured breaths resound like a death knell in your mind, tolling for the end of all hopes of survival, and freedom.*
EmperorDies_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor lies on the floor, about to die. It looks at you with one last pleading glance.

EmperorDies_8.speaker: Narrator
EmperorDies_8.text: *With startling clarity, you realise the mind flayer was telling the truth - if it dies, so do you.*

EmperorDies_5.speaker: Player
EmperorDies_5.text: Get up. I'll fight with you.

EmperorDies_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor struggles to its feet.

EmperorDies_3.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorDies_3.text: With your help, we will both survive.

EmperorDies_6.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorDies_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor collapses. Dead. The same instant, a blinding rift opens behind them. Player reacts to that. White out.

NarratorAD_DescribeOrb_0.speaker: Narrator
NarratorAD_DescribeOrb_0.text: *The orb hums with cerebral magic, permeable, but impenetrable.*

NarratorAD_DescribeOrb_1.speaker: Narrator
NarratorAD_DescribeOrb_1.text: *Within it, the githyanki Prince is as silent as a corpse, but for the murmur of his powers being siphoned away.*

PAD_NotDemonsButGith_0.speaker: Player
PAD_NotDemonsButGith_0.text: So the demonic figures we saw were githyanki all along?

OrbExplodes_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player observes from their arrival point in the Astral Plane, looking across toward the globe of domination, which is a few screens away, across a couple of floating platforms. The globe of domination begins to destabilise - it's about to shatter.

OrbExplodes_6.speaker: Lae'zel
OrbExplodes_6.text: Chk! That orb is about to erupt.

OrbExplodes_1.speaker: Jaheira
OrbExplodes_1.text: Whatever that thing is, it's not going to last much longer.

OrbExplodes_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Some more flickering, then push in on eye socket of the skull as githyanki monks swarm over the exterior. Githyanki monks strike the globe barrier inside the eye socket. One strike lands hard enough to cause the globe to start to splinter.

OrbExplodes_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cracks begin to boil across the surface of the globe. Lightning arcs out from between the cracks forming in the globe, arcing into the foreground. The globe dims slightly as the cracks begin to worsen. A surge of power erupts from within, obliterating one of the floating rocks nearby. Player reaction to the surge. The globe recovers from the surge only briefly before surging again, though not as violently as before.

OrbExplodes_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: The globe of domination becomes still for just a moment - then shatters dramatically.

OrbExplodes_7.speaker: Wyll
OrbExplodes_7.text: Gods - any moment now, that orb is going to explode.

OrbExplodes_9.speaker: Shadowheart
OrbExplodes_9.text: That thing's not going to hold together much longer.

OrbExplodes_10.speaker: Gale
OrbExplodes_10.text: That orb's about to explode - and I speak from some experience.

OrbExplodes_13.speaker: Astarion
OrbExplodes_13.text: That orb's going to blow - and soon.

OrbExplodes_14.speaker: Halsin
OrbExplodes_14.text: Silvanus preserve us - that orb's about to shatter!

DaisyAD_InsideAstralPrisonHurry_2.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_InsideAstralPrisonHurry_2.text: Hurry! I can't hold them back alone!

DaisyAD_InsideAstralPrisonHurry_3.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_InsideAstralPrisonHurry_3.text: The skull - come to the skull!

DaisyAD_InsideAstralPrisonHurry_5.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_InsideAstralPrisonHurry_5.text: I can't hold them off much longer!

PAD_ReactingToOrpheusRocks_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ReactingToOrpheusRocks_0.text: These rocks look ancient. Not sure I could break them if I tried.

AD_EmperorInPain_1.speaker: The Emperor
AD_EmperorInPain_1.text: I am not your enemy - the githyanki are!

AD_EmperorInPain_2.speaker: The Emperor
AD_EmperorInPain_2.text: Stop - I'm the one keeping you alive!

AD_EmperorInPain_3.speaker: The Emperor
AD_EmperorInPain_3.text: What are you doing? HELP ME.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_25.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_25.text: *The events of the last days weigh heavily upon you. Sleep's rest is slow to come to one whose mind is so full.*
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lying down in bedroll, contemplating while trying to fall asleep.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_41.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_41.text: *The Absolute is not a god, but an elder brain controlled by the Chosen of the Dead Three. They mean to use it to take control of the Sword Coast.*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_28.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_28.text: *All who carry the tadpole are governed by the brain, and by extension, the Chosen. It will take but one order to transform them into an army of mind flayers.*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_19.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_19.text: *This would have been your fate too, were it not for the Astral Prism and the mysterious visitor inside of it.*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_17.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_17.text: *This would have been your fate too, were it not for the dream visitor's protection.*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_11.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_11.text: *The very same visitor who Vlaakith seems so eager to kill - and Voss seems so eager to free.*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_9.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_9.text: *The very same visitor who Vlaakith seems so eager to kill.*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_29.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_29.text: *With their help, you have uncovered the cult for what it really is - a plan of conquest orchestrated by the gods of death themselves.*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_15.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_15.text: *Together, you have the power to thwart the Dead Three. If you follow this path to its end, the elder brain will not answer to the Chosen. It will answer to you.*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_42.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_42.text: *A heavy burden indeed. After all, the artefact that protects you came from your own people. What role have they to play in this plane's existence?*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_6.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_6.text: *Lady Shar sent you on this mission - did she know that this is where it would lead?*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_40.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_40.text: *And when you complete it, what will you do then?*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_7.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_7.text: *That you remain alive is a failure to Mystra. But if you were to lay hands on that Crown... might she have reason to forgive you then? Would you even need her forgiveness?*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_44.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_44.text: *And what of the True Souls? Will you liberate them from their parasites and religious delusions? Or will you use the power for your own gain?*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_22.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_22.text: *If the dream visitor speaks true, then the entire Sword Coast is under threat. It will take a true hero to save it. But is that really you?*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_16.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_16.text: *You who are a plaything for a cambion.*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_54.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_54.text: *You who bear the face of a devil.*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_53.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_53.text: *You will finally have the chance to destroy Gortash. But what then? What fires will still burn in you when he is extinguished?*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_14.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_14.text: *You know servitude better than anyone - you have been denied freedom for nearly two centuries, and are denied it still.*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_39.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_39.text: *You are hungry beyond blood, beyond lust, beyond your unliving life itself.*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_4.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_4.text: *And what then? You are prone to impulses as uncontrollable as the gods themselves. Will you even have a say in what you do?*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_18.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_18.text: *Will you liberate the True Souls from their parasites and their religious delusions? Or will you use the power you gain for your own purposes?*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_50.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_50.text: *And what of your father? Will you tear him away from the elder brain's clutches, or allow him to suffer?*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_32.speaker: Player
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_32.text: I've witnessed the Heart of the Absolute. I'm going the learn the secrets of that crown...

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_27.speaker: Player
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_27.text: I will continue in Lady Shar's service. She will never know a more loyal follower. Nor a stronger one.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_36.speaker: Player
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_36.text: First, Gortash. Then, the rest of my life.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_3.speaker: Player
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_3.text: First, I will save my father. Nothing else matters right now.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_20.speaker: Player
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_20.text: I will have my vengeance. Cazador will be dust.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_55.speaker: Player
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_55.text: I will fulfil my duty to my queen. I will ascend!

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_33.speaker: Player
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_33.text: I will do as Voss asked. I will protect the Astral Prism and free the one inside.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_1.speaker: Player
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_1.text: I will reap a savage fate on this world unlike any that has ever been seen.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_37.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_37.text: *Your blood swims hot at the very prospect.*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_38.speaker: Player
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_38.text: I will find a way to rid myself of these disturbing impulses.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_13.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_13.text: *Even as you utter the words to yourself, you know it is but an intention. And these dark desires of yours have little regard for your intentions.*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_43.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_43.text: *You will not have long to wait. All you need to do now is sleep...*
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player begins to fall asleep.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_48.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player is abruptly woken up by the pain in their head from the booming voice of the Absolute.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_12.speaker: GROUP_GLO_VoiceOfTheAbsolute
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_12.text: Hear me. Gather. The reckoning is upon us.
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Booming sounds of the voice of the Absolute throughout this dialogue and into gameplay. Player awakes suddenly, clutching their head in pain, rolling on the ground.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_51.speaker: GROUP_GLO_VoiceOfTheAbsolute
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: The artefact levitates into the air, glowing shaking, rattling, as if fighting something. The player reaches for it but can't lift themself off the ground.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_21.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The cracks in the artefact light up, shafts of light splintering out of it, blinding the player as a portal forms. 

Some of Orpheus' githyanki guard appear out of the portal, braced for combat.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_34.speaker: Player
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_34.text: All I want is to be free of this parasite. I will do what is necessary to make that happen.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_30.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_30.text: *Right now, your resolve feels firm. But there is no knowing how you will feel when the moment comes.*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_47.speaker: Player
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_47.text: I will succeed where the Chosen will fail. I will dominate the world.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_26.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_26.text: *A thrill courses through you at the thought.*

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_5.speaker: Player
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_5.text: When the moment comes, I'll do what feels right.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_8.speaker: Player
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_8.text: I will free everyone of this evil - I will be the hero that saves Baldur's Gate.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_0.speaker: Player
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_0.text: I will heed my companions' needs - I would not have made it this far without them.

WokenUpAtNight_SCO_46.speaker: Narrator
WokenUpAtNight_SCO_46.text: *Will you liberate them from their parasites and their religious delusions? Or will you use the power you gain for your own purposes?*

AD_Gith_CombTheArea_0.speaker: High Gish'ra Sh'ari
AD_Gith_CombTheArea_0.text: Ghaik reinforcements could be with us any moment now...

AD_Gith_CombTheArea_1.speaker: High Gish'ra Sh'ari
AD_Gith_CombTheArea_1.text: Any ghaik auxiliaries must be quashed.

AD_Gith_CombTheArea_2.speaker: High Gish'ra Sh'ari
AD_Gith_CombTheArea_2.text: Search every rock. If the illithid has allies, we must find them before they find us.

DaisyAD_CallToHelp_0.speaker: GROUP_Daisy
DaisyAD_CallToHelp_0.text: We're under attack! Help me. Now.

PAD_LetsJustRest_0.speaker: Player
PAD_LetsJustRest_0.text: An eventful night. Time to get some rest, I think.

AD_FirstContactWithGith_0.speaker: High Gish'ra Sh'ari
AD_FirstContactWithGith_0.text: Friend of ghaik - you will be cleansed!
